    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)

    • playGame

      public static void playGame()
      Starts the general play game loop. Creates an array list of players that will be used to store the data read from the file.

    • gameConclusion

      public static void gameConclusion(Player player)
      Outputs the ending messages and displays the stats of the passed player.
      Parameters:
      player - the player the stats will be displayed for.

    • isInList

      public static boolean isInList(Player player, ArrayList<Player> playerList)
      Checks if a player object with a duplicate name is in the given array list.
      Parameters:
      player - the player being checked for.
      playerList - the list being looked in.
      Returns:
      true if the player object has a matching named object inside the array list.

    • requestPlayerName

      public static String requestPlayerName()
      Asks the player to input their name.
      Returns:
      a String representing the player's name.

    • indexOfPlayer

      public static int indexOfPlayer(String name, ArrayList<Player> playerList)
      Finds the index of a player inside of an array list.
      Parameters:
      name - the commonality being searched for.
      playerList - the array list being searched in.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the index of the desired player object.

    • writePlayers

      public static void writePlayers(String filename, ArrayList<Player> playerList)
      Saves the passed array list to the specified filename.
      Parameters:
      filename - the location of the data file.
      playerList - the array list to be saved.

    • readPlayers

      public static ArrayList<Player> readPlayers(String filename)
      Imports an array list of players from a specified data file.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to import from.
      Returns:
      an array list of players that have been imported from a data file.

    • getYNConfirm

      public static boolean getYNConfirm(String message)
      Safely confirms a user's choice between yes (y) and no (n).
      Parameters:
      message - the message that will be displayed to the user.
      Returns:
      true if the user entered y, false if n.
